item.title: Script error please help
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“Doggie3342, post:3, topic:215400”]the error means just what it says; put a semicolon after “integer”. thats not the only mistake though, i corrected it with the mistakes (mostly syntax errors, some typos) fixed. good learning script i guess.

[quote]program New;
const
waittime = 28;

procedure typestring(line:string);
var i:integer;
singlechar:char;
begin;
for i:=1 to length(line)do
begin
singlechar := StrGet (line, i);
Keydown(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
wait(waittime);
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
end;
end;

begin
repeat
wait(50);
if(IsKeyDown(chr(32)))then
typestring(‘abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz’);
until(IsFKeyDown(1)=true)
end.[/quote]

edit:by the time i finished this post ip-drowner beat me to it. i kinda one-upped him though :p.[/quote]
Here’s your fixed up version. You can find out what’s different ;)[code=geshi]
program New;

const
waittime = 28;

procedure typestring(line:string);
var
i :integer;
singlechar :char;
begin
for i:=1 to length(line)do
begin
singlechar := StrGet(line, i);
Keydown(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
Wait(waittime);
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
end;
end;

begin
repeat
wait(50);
if(IsKeyDown(chr(32)))then
typestring(‘abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz’);
until(IsFKeyDown(1));
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Script error please help
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

the error means just what it says; put a semicolon after “integer”. thats not the only mistake though, i corrected it with the mistakes (mostly syntax errors, some typos) fixed. good learning script i guess.

program New; const waittime = 28;

procedure typestring(line:string);
var i:integer;
singlechar:char;
begin;
for i:=1 to length(line)do
begin
singlechar := StrGet (line, i);
Keydown(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
wait(waittime);
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
end;
end;

begin
repeat
wait(50);
if(IsKeyDown(chr(32)))then
typestring(‘abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz’);
until(IsFKeyDown(1)=true)
end.

edit:by the time i finished this post ip-drowner beat me to it. i kinda one-upped him though :p.

Read full topic

item.title: Script error please help
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

Find:

singchar [b];[/b]= StrGet (line, i);

in your script and replace it with:

singchar [b]:[/b]= StrGet (line, i);

I have highlighted what you needed to change

Read full topic

item.title: Script error please help
item.dc:creator: @nikki-pkz nikki-pkz
item.description:
@nikki-pkz wrote:

yea i was wrighting a script and i keep getting

or] (7.1): Semicolon (’:’) exspected in script) heres

the code if you want to see what the problem might be

[code]program New;
const
waittime = 28;

procedure typestring(line:string);
var i:integer
singlechar;char;
begin
for i:=1 to length(line)do
begin
singchar ;= StrGet (line, i);
Keydown(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
wait(waittime);
KeyUp(GetKeyCode(singlechar));
end;
end;

begin
repeat
wait(50);
if(IsKeyDown(chr(32)))then
typestring('abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
until(IsFKeyDown(1))
end.
[/code]

Read full topic
